title: Peter Hemmings
text:
Peter Hemmings <a href="OBE">OBE</a> (10 April 19344 January 2002) was an English <a href="opera">opera</a> administrator, <a href="impresario">impresario</a> and <a href="singing">singer</a>.
As a singer, he was an accomplished <a href="chorister">chorister</a> in his youth and had a fine <a href="Bass%20%28voice%20type%29">bass voice</a>. He was educated at <a href="Mill%20Hill%20School">Mill Hill School</a> and began his administrative career as president of the <a href="University%20of%20Cambridge">Cambridge University</a> <a href="Cambridge%20University%20Opera%20Group">Opera Group</a>. That company's success led to the founding of the <a href="New%20Opera%20Company">New Opera Company</a> in 1957 with Hemmings as general manager. In 1966, he became the chief administrator of <a href="Scottish%20Opera">Scottish Opera</a>, a position he held for almost 20 years. In 1977, he was appointed general manager of the <a href="Opera%20Australia">Australian Opera</a>, but clashed with the music director, <a href="Richard%20Bonynge">Richard Bonynge</a>. In that difficult time his most significant contribution to opera in Australia was the commissioning of the opera "<a href="Voss%20%28opera%29">Voss</a>" from <a href="Richard%20Meale">Richard Meale</a>. Later, he managed the <a href="London%20Symphony%20Orchestra">London Symphony Orchestra</a> for four years, then accepted a position as the general director of the <a href="Los%20Angeles%20Opera">Los Angeles Opera</a> in 1984. He remained the company's general director until he returned to the UK in 2000 to take up a position on the board of the <a href="Royal%20Opera%2C%20London">Royal Opera</a>. He was survived by his wife Jane née Hemmings, two daughters, two sons and one stepdaughter.
